box2D.dynamics.joints.B2MouseJointDef

type
class
extends
B2JointDef
Mouse joint definition. This requires a world target point, tuning parameters, and the time step.

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
The first attached body.

bodyB : box2D.dynamics.B2Body

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
The second attached body.

collideConnected : Bool

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
Set this flag to true if the attached bodies should collide.

dampingRatio : Float

The damping ratio. 0 = no damping, 1 = critical damping.

frequencyHz : Float

The response speed.

maxForce : Float

The maximum constraint force that can be exerted to move the candidate body. Usually you will express as some multiple of the weight (multiplier * mass * gravity).

target : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2

The initial world target point. This is assumed to coincide with the body anchor initially.

type : Int

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
The joint type is set automatically for concrete joint types.

userData : Dynamic

inherited from box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef
Use this to attach application specific data to your joints.
